reviews.review_text: my favorite use of these are for my ramen, upon, and egg drop soups. if I could find just arugula I would add those to so many dishes. I used to grow arugula and although I am much older and unable to garden, I still love adding greens to my food because I think it adds a bit of me to the dish no matter what country the dish is from. and this blend is great for a simple salad of tomatoes, green onions, and chunks of your favorite cheese. but with gruyere it is divine.

reviews.title: Nice combo, and organic.
reviews.review_text: This is a great salad mix, and the packaging makes it easy to use. I just wish it also had arugula and watercress. I am on a budget, so I have to get those separately and sometimes I cannot afford to do so. Walmart usually does not carry watercress.

reviews.title: Falls Short of Freshness
reviews.review_text: The expiration dates and the quality of the product do not match. In other words, the expiration date may be 4 days away but the salad mix is already deteriorating. A lot of waste goes in my trash because of this. Salad that I paid for but cannot eat.

reviews.title: TASTY, BUT NOT AS ADVERTISED
reviews.review_text: Normally I would recommend the spinach/arugula mix, but on this purchase, there was virtually no arugula at all, just a few tiny wisps, so the package really was 99% spinach. It was good, but not the combination I have received previously in accordance with the package label. Fortunately I had some home-sprouted arugula I was able to add.

It was very fresh and tasty, but since the word Arugula is first on the label, don't u think there should BE SOME in the mix ?? Id say 50% or more since the label says Arugula FIRST ‚ÅâÔ∏è There weren't but 5-10 LEAVES in the whole clamshell. I'll just get straight next time. Do they think we don't notice that kind of RIPOFF ?

reviews.title: moldy and mushy.
reviews.review_text: this is the third time in a row that I have gotten the organic arugula and baby spinach mix and every time it is bad. The last two times it was moldy and had pieces that were mushy it is visibly unsellable yet they're still selling it. I will not be ordering this again.

reviews.title: Had to throw away half of it
reviews.review_text: I've bought this a few times before and had no issues but this time despite the date still being 4 days away, everything was completely soaked and dripping with water. I had to immediately take it out, dry it and put it in a different container. Half of it had already gone bad from being so wet and there was a pool of water in the bottom. So disappointing and a waste of money.

reviews.title: couldnt eat
reviews.review_text: half of it was wilted already and had a date out of 4 more days. but the worst part was the stringy arugula. so bad i choked while swallowing and was completely unable to chew the stems up. like hair!!!! had to spit every bite out. flavor was ok, but i cant eat strings, im 65 and my gut will end me up in the hospital.

The whole container of salad greens was somehow simultaneously dried up %26 withered AND wet %26 slimy. And it was completely visible through the plastic! You would have to actively ignore how gross these greens were to miss it when the shopper chose this item... Oh yeah, while looking it over, i also realized that the seal on the plastic tub was completely opened!It had either been crushed or someone else had already opened it, which would explain how gross the greens are. I can eat this.

*The pkg greens was not sealed. *Many of the greens were shriveled to a glob, and dark green snotty pieces attached to other leaves! I took probably over 1/2 cup, but there are more inside! *Best use by date is tomorrow: Aug. 22nd! *If shopper would have looked at sides of clear package, the dark green decayed ones could have been seen throughout the pkg. I spent enough money on these greens, and they are extreme poor quality! *These
Rotting produce is never a good idea to bring to someone's house, even if the package says good till a few days out, if it is blackened and mushy looking it is rotting!

reviews.title: Found something I didn't like
reviews.review_text: I buy this product frequently and like it overall. But the last time I purchased it I found a tiny bug in one of the spinach leaves. I understand this is an organic product, which is great, but it says it comes washed and I found that there‚Ä¶.

reviews.title: Arugula, lettuce
reviews.review_text: I like this it's just the right size. I don't have it till it goes bad. I hate the big giant packages where I wind up throwing half of it out because it's rotten slimy.

reviews.title: Old
reviews.review_text: Why don't the shoppers get trained how to pick good produce? I am disabled so I use delivery but my produce is always going bad. I love this mix when it's fresh

reviews.title: Not fresh
reviews.review_text: I throw the entire package away because the spinach leaves were full of holes and did not look fresh at all, as it says in the description. The quality was disappointing and not worth buying again.

Would not knowingly order this again. This was a substitute for organic arugula. I have an issue with oxalates and arugula has few oxalates. What I received was an arugula spinach mix, with about 90% spinach and 1p % arugula. So I had to throw it out to the chickens.

reviews.title: Awful
reviews.review_text: I will never again purchase fresh greens from Walmart. This is the SECOND time I received greens with bugs in them. The first time there was a whole intact dead dragonfly- wings and all- beneath layers of leaves. I had already eaten some of the greens before I found it. Now again, an unknown insect buried where I couldn't see and have already eaten from this batch. Additionally, every time I order fresh potatoes I get green (poisonous) potatoes delivered and have to toss the whole bag. Your quality control sucks, your produce is of poor quality and I can't trust you. I'd rather pay slightly more somewhere else than deal with the constant frustration and disappointment of your bad food. You are the %231 retailer on planet earth and this is the best you can do?

reviews.title: Expiration Date on Fresh Produce Too Soon
reviews.review_text: The expiration date on the package (01/19) was dated four days from the day it was delivered (01/15). It doesn't provide enough time to eat it before it begins to wilt and decay. Two similar items were dated 01/22 or seven days from the date of delivery (0/15), which is preferable because it allows time to eat the fresh produce.

reviews.title: Don't bother
reviews.review_text: Was spoiled when I opened it up, 3 days before the ‚Äúuse by‚Äù date!!! Can't tell you how unimpressed I am with this complete waste of money
The product is great. I do curbside pick up due to my MS. The shoppers cheese salad that the expiration date is the next day.

reviews.title: discolored
reviews.review_text: I could not eat this. Many leaves were discolored on top, sides, bottom. No one should eat something like this.
This is completely bad. It has mold on it. I need my money back. I'm going to send you the pictures.

reviews.title: Spring mix
reviews.review_text: I like the organic spring mix and it comes pre-washed, which makes slings easier. Taste is very good.

reviews.title: surprise!
reviews.review_text: love the crisp lettuce, flavor packs a punch, went with everything!!!!!. great snack, great crunch, great mixer

reviews.title: New packaging water-logs expensive veg overnight!
reviews.review_text: Go back to the old packaging... we are not buying this anymore... too expensive to throw out in 2 days.

reviews.title: Nasty
reviews.review_text: On October 3rd I picked this up from Walmart and it has a best of used by date of October 2nd. All slimy and gross.

reviews.title: Spicy, peppery arugula. Can't go wrong.
reviews.review_text: Eat your greens! I love the arugula and since you can rarely find it packaged alone, mixed with baby spinach is the next best thing .
rotten and expired. person shopping should not have put this in my cart. it should have been thrown away. very disappointed

reviews.title: Spoiled produce
reviews.review_text: This arugula and spinach mix added to my order smelled spoiled. I shopped on March 27th and the date on the container said best if used by March 27th.

reviews.title: Just Spinach
reviews.review_text: This was all spinach except for a maybe 6 arugala leaves. I ordered through pick up or never would have gotten. I had originally wanted only arugala and got this instead...so dissappointed.

reviews.title: Food Safety Concern
reviews.review_text: Extremely poor quality and food safety concern. Arugula and Fresh Salad Blend contained 2 long blond hairs upon opening. My hair is gray and short. Disgusting and obviously ineatable. Seriously reconsidering shopping for produce again.
The product itself is good but the box was delivered open. This makes me question safety of the food. Walmart needs to offer optional tamper-proof seals for selected grocery bags.

BTW I picked up this order at 3:00. Salad blend NOT FRESH this time. All Arugala is yellow, past prime. Never happened before. Online application is impossible to use especially on cell phone. Can't tell how and where to navigate nor where to respond. Shopping at Walmart may not work for me any more....
This salad is consistently tasty. Arugula and spinach go very well together.

reviews.title: old salad
reviews.review_text: this item was expired. this should have lasted all week. the second item i threw in the garbage.

reviews.title: A favorite ‚Ä¶
reviews.review_text: Always fresh, nutritious %26 affordable!
Didn't give it 5 stars because even tho it said arugala on the PKG, there wasn't any in it.

reviews.title: Smelly and old Walmart spinach!
reviews.review_text: Already old and smelly when we received it! Had to throw it out!
if not used after opening within 3 days ,they become water soft and unable to enjoy
Wrong item. I received just arugula and should have been arugula and spinach.
no much to say. it met my expectations; I loved it.
i have a sale item vs my order. i was charged 2.98 and the sale item is 2:53
Purchased yesterday through pickup. Expiration date today‚Ä¶.three fourths rotten. Threw away
The arugula spinach combo was great. I'd prefer a true clamshell. I buy this weekly.
Best produce I've ever gotten at Walmart. Good case for buying organic
This is the only option for arugula, but there is very little arugula in the mix.

reviews.title: Spinach and Arugula leaves
reviews.review_text: I buy this kind because I know it's good for you and I like cooking with it. Tastes good!

reviews.title: Yuck
reviews.review_text: Ordered as a pick up item. Yellow leaves and slimy spinach. Will not order produce here again
I love arugula and it's got good vitamins and it just tastes good

reviews.title: Produce issue again
reviews.review_text: The arugula looks faded and old :(

reviews.title: nasty
reviews.review_text: was an online order. when i got home (40 min drive) all rotten in container. one of the 5 loose apples i bought was rotten

reviews.title: "Baby Arugula and Spinach "
reviews.review_text: 1st time getting this. Great item that has both arugula and spinach. Was fresh. Great value. Will purchase again.

reviews.title: Look closely before purchasing
reviews.review_text: Half of the arugula was yellow and spotty. It was wet and slimy at the bottom of the container. If I didn't pick through first thing, the whole container would have gone bad way before it's expiration date of next week.

reviews.title: Quality of produce
reviews.review_text: This item has the date of July 10 but some of the leaves have turned yellow are the item has wilted and doesn't look very fresh. So sorry to complain but wanted you to know.

reviews.title: Online delivery
reviews.review_text: I receive this salad , and it was already rotting . Nothing but liquid seeping out and mold smh !

reviews.title: Bad spinach and arugula
reviews.review_text: One day from Expiring picked by Walmart employee. Wilted and watery. Smelled horrible.

reviews.title: favorite salad mix üëå
reviews.review_text: favorite salad mix for one to 2 persons. Great quality and already cleaned. üëå

reviews.title: Delicious
reviews.review_text: This is the only cheese I can tolerate. It's tangy, delicious and healthy. I love it!

reviews.title: "Bad Salad"
reviews.review_text: I received an expired salad!! I had to throw it away and buy a new one!

reviews.title: "Do not order online! "
reviews.review_text: The container is bent up like it was drop kicked

The new packaging makes the product go bad faster. It creates way more condensation and I have to put a paper towel in to make it last longer. We have returned them before because everything is soggy and soft inside. We look closer now on the ones we choose.

reviews.title: Yum, you should get it!
reviews.review_text: This is a delicious mix. I love making salads with the Spinach/Arugula mix. It doesn't get really watery or soggy like some other lettuce mixes. It has a great flavor, and the peppery bite of the arugula is a perfect balance to the mellowness of the spinach.

reviews.title: Keep the arugula coming!
reviews.review_text: Arugula adds and nice peppery(?) flavor to the healthy spinach. Too often it is stocked sparingly and out of stock, compared to baby spinach being sold by itself. I think it would be nice if you sold arugula on its own, and then I might but 2 or 3 baby spinach which is usually much more available. I enjoy salads often, but other spinach mixes with some lettuce, esp with the purplish leaves, seem to go bad too quickly.

reviews.title: Nasty!
reviews.review_text: This is the second time I bought the Organic Marketside ‚Äúwashed and ready to eat‚Äù salad and after eating some of it, I found a nasty slug. The first time I just dumped the entire container and thought: It is not worth it complaining cause they will just give me a refund‚Ä¶ But twice is too much! Nothing about the price but I feel so disgusted it will take me some time to buy salad again. Can you please help me with this matter as it is still a little problem? And, by the way‚Ä¶. It came full of old/yellow leaves, super bad quality!

reviews.title: Like eating a ream of copier paper.
reviews.review_text: Mine wasn't wilted like other reviewers. Instead, the spinach was stiff as a board and the arugula was 90% stems. I rinsed about 1/3 of the package (never believe it's clean) but it wasn't dirty. It also didn't soften as I cut it. It was literally like I had a stack of copier paper in front of me that I tried to slice. It stayed stiff as a board. Never got softer. So I let the cottage cheese and my homemade dressing sit in the mix for a bit. Still nothing. Never improved. I'm going to have to cook it because these are not salad quality greens. And we're talking baby spinach here not kale. So stems and shards. Won't get again.

reviews.title: Don't bring me outdated items please
reviews.review_text: I don't like receiving an item that outdates in the day I receive it. Especially a perishable like this ‚Ä¶Best Buy date is 9/26‚Äìwhich is today. I'd rather be told it is unavailable than receive this type of perishable ‚Äî-can't eat that in one day!it looks soggy and not good

reviews.title: Where's the Arugula?
reviews.review_text: The greens were fresh and good quality. However, there was hardly any arugula! (i bought this online for pick up %26 specifically wanted arugula for a recipe. it's hard to buy just arugula these days, so I had to settle for this.) Baby arugula gets top billing on the label and is listed first in ingredients. So this was a let down from the arugula standing. I am serious when i say my package was about 10% arugula. üòí

reviews.title: The arugula in spinach combo is old and yellow. .
reviews.review_text: I wanted just arugula but it wasn't available, so was substituted with arugula/spinach mix. The last several time I've ordered this mix preciously, the arugula had turned yellow way before the use by date. So I stopped ordering it. Yesterday (7/5) I really wanted arugula, so let the mix be substituted. The use by date on box is 7/9 ..but a lot of arugula was already yellow when I received it.

reviews.title: Not a happy customer
reviews.review_text: The veggies in the package was withered and some brown. Basically not eatable. I don‚Äôt understand why they sell rotten food to customers? I‚Äôm not getting delivery or pick up anymore, not the first time receiving vegetables that should have been trashed. Shopping in the store for me!

reviews.title: Alba was the worst delivery driver ever.
reviews.review_text: So 12 items were unavailable. We are talking about basic stuff like lemons, bell pepper, chips and mint leaves. Plus the disrespectful driver left my food in untied bags out side on the floor in the parking lot of the building. Not anywhere near my apartment door that's on the 3rd floor. It sat outside for hours because my daughter kept telling me the delivery had not arrived yet. Finally management called me to tell me my groceries were outside on the dirty ground. Worst service I have ever experienced.

reviews.title: Soggy and Rotten
reviews.review_text: I didn't choose this myself. it was my shopper that shopped for me at Walmart. I went to open it this morning and barely any of it was usable. it was all rotten and slimy. This hasn't happened to me before with this product. I think I will have to be buying it in person to look at it in order to purchase it again.

reviews.title: Disappointing Mixture
reviews.review_text: I really just wanted arugula but Walmart doesn't offer arugula on it's own. Since it was a mix of 2 things I expected it to be a 50/50 mix. I was disappointed, greatly. There was just a sprinkle of arugula in the package. The arugula that is in the box is really tiny, like really tiny. It's more like a little arugula fell into the box by accident. The spinach was really good. It had great flavor, it was almost sweet, about the best spinach I ever got from a grocery store. I wasn't buying the box for spinach I was buying it for the arugula which was almost non-existent. It was such a poor example it shouldn't even be sold as an arugula/spinach mix, it's not an honest representation. Frankly I've gotten more arugula in a spring salad mix. This was just plain sad, the company should be ashamed of itself for packaging this as a mix.

reviews.title: Arugula
reviews.review_text: I eat arugula daily so to receive this in my pickup order was disappointing. It smelled stahl yellow and wilted. I hope I can get a refund. I suggest the Hillsborough Walmart check the fresh produce daily and if it looks like this throw it out or give it to the cows!

reviews.title: Dissatisfaction
reviews.review_text: I ordered a 5oz. container of "Fresh" Organic Arugula %26 Spinach, Blend...I Did Not Receive "Fresh" But "Wilted Organic" Veggies with brown water %26 slimmy to the touch which indicates that the container was several days old which should have been removed from shelf...I expect "Fresh Organic" Veggies...Educate the Person that pulled it from the shelf...Thank's for granting Me to Write a Review in Hopes Corrections will be made...

reviews.title: Soggy/slimy pieces even when opened before date
reviews.review_text: Have ordered this multiple times. Recently even with 5 days before "best by" date and on first open there is already wilted/yellowed arugula and soggy/slimy spinach pieces in it. This time there was so much that I had to pitch whole container. Other times I have to pick through the whole container to rinse the slimy bits. Their quality on organic is not good. Took the pics 3/8 when first opened, best by date was 3/15 Guess I'll start picking a different brand.

reviews.title: Needs better packing to retain FRESHNESS
reviews.review_text: I like the lettuce, but after a few days it gets very watery and soggy. They need to wrap it in paper towel or a different type of packaging. Sad to say, it doesn't even last a week. Also as the days go on the lettuce starts to smell, and it is niot even a week old. Why is that? My husband will not eat it once he smells that odor.

reviews.title: Rotten produce not to be sold
reviews.review_text: Rotten! Should have been thrown away instead of sold!!
My spring mix was 1/2 rotten looks like it had been frozen

reviews.title: not so good
reviews.review_text: the fresh arula was already yellow and wilted :(

reviews.title: better off buying argula separately
reviews.review_text: not alot of arugula here

reviews.title: Opened and moldy
reviews.review_text: When I unloaded this at home the box was opened. I inspected it to see if it was okay but the spinach smelled horrible and it was covered in black dots that look like mold. Had to throw the whole thing away.

reviews.title: Horrific
reviews.review_text: Opened the organic salad container to place on my dinner plate. While sitting at the dinner table I see a large green bug with antennas crawling on the salad stem. I was utterly disgusted.

reviews.title: Expiring date gave me one day to use it!!!
reviews.review_text: I ordered baby arugula and was substituted with arugula and spinach (I okayed) and then he picks out one that expires in one day!!! Who does that ??somebody who doesn't know how to shop!!!

reviews.title: Spinach that expires the next day
reviews.review_text: I received groceries on the 3rd of December and received spinach that expired the very next day. Salad that expired in two days. Shoppers are not paying attention to Dates

reviews.title: very dissapointed
reviews.review_text: I have bought this for the past almost year. It was my favorite but the last 3 times has been 95% spinach and 5% arugula. Will not buy anymore. Needs to have equal amounts of each like before. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: ALWAYS check the date when doing a pick up order.
reviews.review_text: Wal-Mart pickup order on 6/21/24, product was dated to expire on 6/22/2024. Product was rotten and I threw it out. Cannot get a refund because I no longer have the rotten product.

reviews.title: Slimy upon delivery.
reviews.review_text: I received these "fresh" greens today. 3 hours later I opened them to make a salad. They were slimy already! And when I tried to return them the window had closed already! Things are changing and not for the better. üòë
The lettuce was half bad. It, also, had one of those invasive Japanese beetles in it. I can't request a refund because the website keeps give an error message from their side.

reviews.title: wilted and crushed container
reviews.review_text: The container was crushed in. that aside and somewhat understandable; the greens were wilted, mostly brown and black. smelled horrible. will not order this again.
some leaves were discolored. not happy about that. i expect the shopper would take care and make an effort to get the best quality for their customer

reviews.title: Bad and wilted leafs at pick up.
reviews.review_text: The leafs are already bad and wilted. Very disappointing with this pick made by Walmart. I would like to not have to immediately throw it away right after receiving it.

reviews.title: Wilted and Spotty Leaves
reviews.review_text: The produce was full of condensation and many of the leaves were wilted and yellow as well as mushy. Some had spots on them, as if molding. I have ordered this before and it wasn't this bad.

reviews.title: Fresh
reviews.review_text: This spinach/arugula mix has always been nice and fresh for me. It's freshness seems to last a while after it's home. I really wish Walmart carried just plain arugula but this one is still good

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.review_text: I love keeping a package of this in my fridge. It makes a great salad but I add it to sandwiches, add it to soups, sauce and stews. I've had good luck keeping it fresh by putting a paper towel in the container after I open it

reviews.title: Not acceptable arugula and spinach mix
reviews.review_text: Arugula and spinach mix was part of a curb pick-up order. When I got home on 10/20 I saw the best by date was 10/20. The leaves on the top were wilted and shriveled; ones on the bottom were sopping wet.

reviews.title: plastic in spinach arugula salid mix
reviews.review_text: bit of plastic in salad mix. thank goodness i stopped chewing. plastic hard like brook off hard plastic container. the quality of spinch, long thick stem, next to no arugula

reviews.title: Nearly spoiled
reviews.review_text: Although the date was 02/11/24, the salad mix was half spoiled‚Äîonly half of the salad mixture edible left. In-store shoppers need to check and recheck all produce items.

reviews.title: Another great Walmart Find.
reviews.review_text: Another great Walmart Find. Organic Arugula and Spinach Mix at a reasonable price. Very fresh and it keeps for days in the fridge - no more wilted greens.

reviews.title: Good Luck finding the arugula!
reviews.review_text: Misleading label - Aren't food items suppose to be listed in order of the most volume first?? This should be called "Spinach and Arugula" and should be listed in that order under ingredients. There might have been 1 cup of tiny arugula and about 8 cups spinach. If I wanted Spinach - I'd have bought the regular Spinach container! It should be illegal to sell something marketed in this manner.

reviews.title: No
reviews.review_text: I bought this package of spinach and arugula salad mix, and was actually very excited to eat it because I love spinach and arugula. Taste wise tasted like any other spinach and arugula mix, except I found a small gray bird feather in mind when I sat down to enjoy a salad. And that instantly made me think about how birds carry tons of germs and that is extremely disgusting. So the fact that I was about to eat that little feather was pretty gross.

reviews.title: Not fresh
reviews.review_text: Once we got home and opened the bag we realized it was past it's prime and had started getting slimy.

reviews.title: Excellent product. Never disappoints!
reviews.review_text: Always crisp and fresh, this makes a fabulous salad. I add lettuce and homemade vinaigrette dressing.
it was all yellow and expires in 3 days...not helpful for what i need it for. it is already going bad. very disappointed in thia pick.

reviews.title: as fresh as any other
reviews.review_text: as fresh as any grocery spring mix. it goes bad fairly quickly but what do you expect. im just glad theres a pickup option for fresh arugula!
Please look at the date. I'd prefer to get produce that doesn't have a ‚Äúbest if used by‚Äù date of the same day I get it.

reviews.title: Expired and rotten
reviews.review_text: 3 days past use by date. Product was rotting and dripping green rot fluid out of the container. I can not imagine anyone would put this in any order.

reviews.title: Stays fresh
reviews.review_text: Stays fresh for at least a week and a half after opening the package. I like the mix of arugula and spinach because it goes with everything.

reviews.title: Bad arugula and spinach
reviews.review_text: Just picked up this item. It is wet and slimy on the inside bottom of the box. Looks like it might have been frozen. I would like a credit

reviews.title: Spinach with yellow spots all over
reviews.review_text: Not sure why every box with mix leafs, spinach has white/yellow spots. Not worth it, waist of money :(

reviews.title: Rotten
reviews.review_text: The product was rotten before its expiration day. How can someone pick up a product that is clearly rotten?
Best buy date was the same as delivery date. I would not have purchased this item if I had been doing the shopping myself.

reviews.title: Don't buy
reviews.review_text: The arugula and spinach were so slimy and yellow, they were inedible. Had to throw out the entire package.

reviews.title: the arugula spinach was completely spoiled
reviews.review_text: this whole container was spoiled! slimy and gross! couldn't use it had to toss the whole thing. wheres the option for return or refund?
I did a curbside order when I got home this was spoilt I'm still on the phone after 2 hours trying to get a refund

reviews.title: NO ARUGULA
reviews.review_text: where oh where is the Arugula?????? Supposed to be baby arugula and baby spinach - it was all spinach!!!

reviews.title: Fresh and long lasting
reviews.review_text: I always look for the freshest one by the date on package. It lasts a long time in frig. I love the fact that it is pre washed and ready to eat.

reviews.title: Not washed
reviews.review_text: Contrary to the label, this was not ‚Äúwashed and ready to eat.‚Äù It was actually covered in dirt and wilting.

reviews.title: #WheresTheArugula??
reviews.review_text: I'm not exactly sure how Arugula got top billing on this mix? There's hardly any in there. Almost exclusively Spinach. I really had to pick through this mix to find the few sprigs that were included. Very disappointing lunch. :(

reviews.title: salad
reviews.review_text: These packaged salads have to be used up quickly or they spoil.

reviews.title: not fresh greens!
reviews.review_text: Arrugala turned yellow way agead of the expiry date.

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.review_text: It's delicious, fresh and reasonably priced. I buy it weekly.

reviews.title: Salad Mix
reviews.review_text: This was absolutely fresh, crisp, and delicious! The best salad mix i have ever had!

reviews.title: Deliciously healthy
reviews.review_text: Great complement to combine with the salad bags that Walmart sells.

reviews.title: Bad
reviews.review_text: I opened the container %26 it smelled horribly. The spinach %26 arugula was wet

reviews.title: expired lettuce
reviews.review_text: quit buying me expired or near expired lettuce!

reviews.title: Terrible.
reviews.review_text: All the arugula and spinach were old and wrinkly.

reviews.title: Expired product delivered
reviews.review_text: The salad was labeled Jan 17 and was delivered Jan 19. It was moldy and stinky when I opened it

reviews.title: Yellow arugula.
reviews.review_text: Much is unusable‚Ä¶.yellow, old arugula.

reviews.title: organic Argalia an Baby Spinach
reviews.review_text: dated Oct. 12th. should not have been sent

reviews.title: Better than Spinach
reviews.review_text: Delicious Fresh Flavor and packaging is nice and secure yet easy to open and close.

reviews.title: Greens matter most!!!
reviews.review_text: They both last really long time. Very healthy!!!

reviews.title: Last 3 packages not worth it
reviews.review_text: I have bought this many times and have been happy with it. But the last three packages have been bad. Two of them had next to no arugula in the package and all three spoiled within three days of purchase. I can't waste money on this anymore. I spent $3.46 for each one.

reviews.title: Used to be a great product. What changed?
reviews.review_text: This has been my go-to salad mix for quite a while. It has always been fresh and tasty. Sometimes the arugula was a little on the light side, but overall usually an equal balance between spinach and arugula. However, something recently has changed in the quality of this product. My last purchase was 11-13-2018. All the veggies were dripping wet and limp. Nasty is the best description. This is the second straight package that has been like this. It looks like they have quit spin drying the veggies after washing and now they are sealed inside package wet and are just plain disgusting. My advice to Walmart is, find out why these salads used to be so fresh, crisp, and dry with nary a trace of water inside the package. Sooner or later someone is going to get sick from this product the haphazard way they are packaged now.

reviews.title: Bold flavor
reviews.review_text: This package of lettuce has just the right combination of arugula and spinach to give it a nice bold flavor without being too strong. The lettuce is pre washed and ready to put directly into a bowl to eat. After opening, the lettuce stays fresh in the container for several days.

reviews.title: WALMART CAN DO BETTER!!!
reviews.review_text: This is my first time ordering food and other stuff online for delivery. Too many items were Out of Stock. Geeezzzzz! The person that packed my order was careless when choosing the best items as promised by Walmart. A fresh Green Pepper that is ruin was shipped to me, yuck. The Organic Marketside Baby Arugula and Baby Spinach is starting to wither. I don't eat food that is starting to rot, why send it. I don't eat food with current or past the expiration date. The label stated, "BEST IF USED BY November 17, 2021" which is today. Evidently, the date was ignored by the person that packed my order for delivery. Anyhow, both items are going back to Walmart.

reviews.title: Sad all the way around
reviews.review_text: Poor quality Purchsed on 2/27/17 good till 3/4/17 opened today to have a great salad for lunch but not in the stars for me. First I opened package and found most disturbing smell. Upon further inspection most of the bottom leaves had been rotten also there is very little arugula in hi s pack. Will return and may look for other options as this is not the first return and I drive a good 45 min to the store.

I was having trouble because a carton of orange juice was partially opened and spilled all over my hand. Immediately one of your associates brought some wipes for my hand. We were very impressed with this. A little later another associate asked if we found everything we were shopping for. I‚Äôm sorry I didn‚Äôt get their names to pass along to you.

reviews.title: Garden Fresh, Garden Crisp Salad Greens
reviews.review_text: Garden fresh, garden crisp, very clean greens. I eat a salad every weekday . . . Properly stored these greens remain fresh for a least a week. Highly recommended.
